Class Drawing

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Drawing
Direct Known Subclasses:
CDrawing, GDrawing
public abstract class Drawing
extends java.lang.Object

Manages line drawings. This abstract superclass keeps track of what shapes have been drawn, what item has been selected, whether the drawing is visible or not, and the size of the drawing. Subclasses provide the actual drawing operations. Supports various shapes, including lines, rectangles, and circles.

Version:
1.2 -- March 16, 1999
Author:
C. Vickery

deleteItem

public void deleteItem(int item)
                throws DrawingException
Deletes a numbered item from the list of drawn items. The item number, i, must satisfy 0 <= i < n, where n is the number of items currently in the drawing list.
Parameters:
item - Index of the item to delete.
Returns:
void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the item number is invalid.

public void deleteItem()
                throws DrawingException
Deletes the currently selected item from the list of drawn items.
Parameters:
None. -  
Returns:
void
Throws:
DrawingException - If no item is selected.

drawLine

public void drawLine(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2)
              throws DrawingException
Records information needed to draw a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2).
Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of first endpoint
y1 - Y coordinate of first endpoint
x2 - X coordinate of second endpoint
y2 - Y coordinate of second endpoint
Returns:
void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the coordinates are not within the bounds of the current drawing.

drawRectangle

public void drawRectangle(int x1,
                          int y1,
                          int width,
                          int height)
                   throws DrawingException
Records information needed to draw a rectangle with upper left corner at (x1,y1), and the given width and height. The edges of the rectangle will be parallel to the axes.
Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of first corner
y1 - Y coordinate of first corner
width - Width of the rectangle
height - Height of the rectangle
Returns:
Void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the rectangle goes outside the drawing.

drawCircle

public void drawCircle(int x1,
                       int y1,
                       int diameter)
                throws DrawingException
Records information needed to draw a circle bounded by a rectangle defined by (x1,y1), width, and height, where width and height are the diameter of the circle.
Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of the center of the circle.
y1 - Y coordinate of the center of the circle.
diameter - Width / height of the bounding rectangle.
Returns:
Void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the bounding rectangle goes outside the drawing.

listItems

public java.lang.String listItems()
Returns a String with a line of text describing each item in the drawing. The selected item (if any) is indicated with an asterisk.
Parameters:
Void -  
Returns:
A printable string with one line for each item in the drawing.

highlightItem

public void highlightItem(int item)
                   throws DrawingException
Mark an item in the drawing to be highlighted. The item number, i, must satisfy 0 <= i < n, where n is the number of items currently in the drawing list.
Parameters:
item - The integer identifier for the item.
Returns:
Void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the item number is not valid.

unhighlightItem

public void unhighlightItem(int item)
                     throws DrawingException
Marks and item in the drawing as unhighlighted. The item number, i, must satisfy 0 <= i < n, where n is the number of items currently in the drawing list. The item must actually actually be highlighted when this method is invoked.
Parameters:
item - The integer identifier for the item.
Returns:
Void
Throws:
DrawingException - If the item number is not valid.
